original_text: The lateral force, Q, is measured and recorded throughout the entire test by a piezoelectric load cell which is connected to the quasi-stationary LSMB. The LSMB is mounted on flexures which provide flexibility in the horizontal direction so that the majority of the lateral force is transmitted though the much stiffer load path which contains the load cell as shown in Fig. 2. Both displacement and load sensors have been calibrated (both externally and in-situ) in static conditions. The load and displacement signals are sampled at a rate of two hundred measurements per fretting cycle at all fretting frequencies, with these data being used to generate fretting loops. The loops were used to derive the contact slip amplitude and the energy coefficient of friction in each cycle according to the method suggested by Fouvry et al. [17]. Average values for these were calculated for each test (the average coefficient of friction included values associated with the initial transients in the tests as suggested by Hirsch and Neu [18]).
original_translation: La fuerza lateral, Q, se mide y registra durante todo el ensayo mediante una celda de carga piezoeléctrica que está conectada al LSMB cuasi-estacionario. El LSMB está montado en flexures que proporcionan flexibilidad en la dirección horizontal para que la mayoría de la fuerza lateral se transmita a través de la ruta de carga mucho más rígida que contiene la celda de carga, como se muestra en la Fig. 2. Tanto los sensores de desplazamiento como de carga han sido calibrados (tanto externa como in situ) en condiciones estáticas. Las señales de carga y desplazamiento se muestrean a una velocidad de doscientas mediciones por ciclo de fretting en todas las frecuencias de fretting, y estos datos se utilizan para generar bucles de fretting. Los bucles se utilizaron para derivar la amplitud de deslizamiento de contacto y el coeficiente de fricción de energía en cada ciclo según el método sugerido por Fouvry et al. [17]. Se calcularon valores promedio para cada ensayo (el coeficiente de fricción promedio incluyó valores asociados con los transitorios iniciales en los ensayos, como sugirieron Hirsch y Neu [18]).

The loops were used to derive the contact slip amplitude and the energy coefficient of friction in each cycle according to the method suggested by Fouvry et al. [17].
Average values for these were calculated for each test (the average coefficient of friction included values associated with the initial transients in the tests as suggested by Hirsch and Neu [18]).

Las señales de carga y desplazamiento se muestrean a una velocidad de doscientas mediciones por ciclo de fretting en todas las frecuencias de fretting, y estos datos se utilizan para generar bucles de fretting.

original_annotated_sentences:
The lateral force, Q, is measured and recorded throughout the entire test by a
piezoelectric load cell
which is connected to the quasi-stationary LSMB.

The LSMB is mounted on flexures which provide flexibility in the horizontal direction so that the majority of the lateral force is transmitted though the much stiffer load path which contains the load cell as shown in Fig. 2.
Both displacement and load sensors have been calibrated (both externally and in-situ) in static conditions.
The load and displacement signals are sampled at a rate of two hundred measurements per fretting cycle at all fretting frequencies, with these data being used to generate fretting loops.
The loops were used to derive the contact slip amplitude and the energy coefficient of friction in each cycle according to the method suggested by Fouvry et al. [17].
Average values for these were calculated for each test (the average coefficient of friction included values associated with the initial transients in the tests as suggested by Hirsch and Neu [18]).
